name: feudally

in a way that relates to the social system of western Europe in the Middle Ages, or to any society that is organized according to rank: At that time, society in Japan was feudally organized. The arrival of industrialization transformed what had been a feudally structured society.
More examplesFewer examplesThe concept of the church, the nobility, and the common people, known as the "three estates", was a feudally inspired one. The feudally constrained citizens soon began to organize themselves and began a revolt.
